attributes.content: KfW is a German state-owned investment and development bank, based in Frankfurt. KfW provides financing for development aid to developing countries. KfW's "financial cooperation" is complemented by "technical cooperation" by GIZ and other German public agencies. The main sectors of financial cooperation are water supply and sanitation, renewable energy and energy efficiency, as well as the development of the financial sector. KfW Development Bank also works, among other sectors, in health, education, agriculture, forestry, solid waste management.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) is a multilateral development bank (MDB) dedicated to enhancing social and economic development in its member countries and Muslim communities worldwide, aiming to achieve substantial impact at scale. IsDB provides essential infrastructure to empower individuals to lead improved lives and reach their full potential. Spanning across four continents, IsDB unites 57 member countries, impacting approximately 1 in 5 of the world’s population.

body.value:
The Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) is a multilateral development bank (MDB) dedicated to enhancing social and economic development in its member countries and Muslim communities worldwide, aiming to achieve substantial impact at scale.

IsDB provides essential infrastructure to empower individuals to lead improved lives and reach their full potential.

Spanning across four continents, IsDB unites 57 member countries, impacting approximately 1 in 5 of the world’s population.

As one of the most active MDBs globally and a leader in Islamic Finance, IsDB holds an AAA rating and manages operating assets exceeding USD 16 billion, with subscribed capital amounting to USD 70 billion.

Headquartered in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, IsDB operates major hubs in Morocco, Malaysia, Kazakhstan, and Senegal, with gateway offices strategically located in Egypt, Turkey, Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Nigeria.

IsDB fosters collaborative efforts among member nations in a neutral and non-political setting, dedicated to advancing the welfare of humanity.

body.value: The Ministry of Works and Transport exists to formulate policies and plans, set standards, build capacity, carry out advocacy, and regulate, monitor, and evaluate the Works and Transport sector. attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development is a Government Ministry which plays an important role to ensure mobilization of public resources for the whole Government. The Ministry commonly known as Ministry of Finance is further charged to oversee how these resources are accounted for as they target to benefit all Ugandans.

body.value:
Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development is a Government Ministry which plays an important role to ensure mobilization of public resources for the whole Government. The Ministry commonly known as Ministry of Finance is further charged to oversee how these resources are accounted for as they target to benefit all Ugandans.


The Ministry is also concerned with matters of achieving the fastest rate of economic transformation alongside emerging economies. It targets to formulate sound economic policies that lead to sustainable economic growth and development. The ministry is organized with Directorates of Budget, Economic Affairs, Accountant General’s Office and departments of Finance and Administration.

attributes.content: Sogea-Satom is a leading construction and civil engineering company operating primarily in Africa. As a subsidiary of the VINCI Group, Sogea-Satom specializes in a wide range of infrastructure projects, including roads, bridges, water supply systems, and urban development. The company is recognized for its expertise in delivering complex projects that enhance the infrastructure and support the economic growth of the regions in which it operates.

body.value:
Sogea-Satom is a leading construction and civil engineering company operating primarily in Africa. As a subsidiary of the VINCI Group, Sogea-Satom specializes in a wide range of infrastructure projects, including roads, bridges, water supply systems, and urban development. The company is recognized for its expertise in delivering complex projects that enhance the infrastructure and support the economic growth of the regions in which it operates.

With a strong focus on sustainability, safety, and innovation, Sogea-Satom integrates advanced engineering solutions and environmentally responsible practices into its work. The company is committed to contributing to the development of local communities by providing high-quality services, fostering local employment, and engaging in social and environmental initiatives. Through its extensive experience and dedication to excellence, Sogea-Satom continues to build a solid reputation as a trusted partner in Africa's construction and infrastructure sectors.

The company is driven by a fleet-footed and experienced management team, with support from a staff complement of over 100 employees, whose spectrum of specialization runs across operators, technicians, engineers, tradesmen, and contract employees. Fossil is a Category A ranked member of the ZBCA, Category A ranked member of CIFOZ & Category A ranked member of the Ministry of local government, Public Works& National Housing, which accolades are the highest possible rankings for any construction company in Zimbabwe., Fossil’

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Moroccan National Railways Office (ONCF) is Morocco's national railway operator and is responsible for the planning, operation, and maintenance of the country’s rail network. Established in 1963, ONCF plays a critical role in the transportation sector, offering both passenger and freight services.

body.value:
The Moroccan National Railways Office (ONCF) is Morocco's national railway operator and is responsible for the planning, operation, and maintenance of the country’s rail network. Established in 1963, ONCF plays a critical role in the transportation sector, offering both passenger and freight services.

ONCF is committed to enhancing Morocco's railway infrastructure, modernizing its network, and improving service quality, particularly through high-speed rail projects like the Kenitra-Marrakech High-Speed Line. The office also focuses on expanding Morocco's rail connections, aiming to support regional and international trade while contributing to sustainable development.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: SGTM, a leading player in construction and public works, has developed multidisciplinary expertise over half a century to meet the growing infrastructure needs in Morocco and Africa. The bridges, roads, ports, and urban infrastructure built by SGTM serve as strategic links that have significantly contributed to the continent's development, aligning with the continental vision of His Majesty King Mohamed VI. With excellence and innovation as its pillars, SGTM aims to become a benchmark of quality across the continent.

body.value:
SGTM, a leading player in construction and public works, has developed multidisciplinary expertise over half a century to meet the growing infrastructure needs in Morocco and Africa. The bridges, roads, ports, and urban infrastructure built by SGTM serve as strategic links that have significantly contributed to the continent's development, aligning with the continental vision of His Majesty King Mohamed VI. With excellence and innovation as its pillars, SGTM aims to become a benchmark of quality across the continent. Leveraging its versatility and global expertise, the company is investing in new vital sectors to build the Morocco and Africa of tomorrow.

SGTM specializes in five key areas: hydraulic facilities, commercial and industrial buildings, transportation infrastructure and artistic structures, mining and energy, and maritime and river works. Each of these sectors demands precise expertise and specific skills. SGTM’s team of professionals offers their know-how and experience to understand clients' challenges, needs, and constraints, providing tailored, innovative, and sustainable solutions. The company collaborates closely with clients to meet their most ambitious challenges, combining technical precision with a commitment to timelines and cost-efficiency.

attributes.content: The LAPSSET Corridor Development Authority (LCDA) was established by the Kenya government in 2013 to plan, coordinate and manage the implementation of the Lamu Port-South Sudan-Ethiopia Transport Corridor (LAPSSET) Project.  The LAPSSET Corridor Project is an infrastructure project dedicated to interconnecting the East African countries of Kenya, Ethiopia and South Sudan. On completion the infrastructure corridor would link a major new port development on Kenya’s Indian Ocean coast to South Sudan and Ethiopia.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Tanzania Land Transport Regulatory Authority (LATRA) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Land Transport Regulatory Authority (LATRA) is a Government Authority established by Act of Parliament No. 3 of 2019. This Act repealed the former Land and Water Transport Regulatory Authority (SUMATRA) Act. LATRA is mandated to regulate the land transport sector, particularly freight and passenger transport (long-distance buses, urban buses, freight vehicles, taxis, two-wheelers and three-wheelers), rail transport and cable transport. LATRA’s headquarters are in Dodoma and the Authority has offices in all twenty-six (26) regions of Mainland Tanzania.

body.value:
The Land Transport Regulatory Authority (LATRA) is a Government Authority established by Act of Parliament No. 3 of 2019. This Act repealed the former Land and Water Transport Regulatory Authority (SUMATRA) Act. LATRA is mandated to regulate the land transport sector, particularly freight and passenger transport (long-distance buses, urban buses, freight vehicles, taxis, two-wheelers and three-wheelers), rail transport and cable transport. LATRA’s headquarters are in Dodoma and the Authority has offices in all twenty-six (26) regions of Mainland Tanzania.

Transportation is a necessary service and an important indicator of development in any society. Developments in transportation services reflect changes in lifestyle, civilization, and economic development.

In this era, the use of modern technology is revolutionizing various sectors, including the land transport sector, LATRA facilitates the use of such technologies as a solution to challenges in the transport sector. This is done with the participation of stakeholders from the public and private sectors. One of the achievements recognized is the Vehicle Tracking System (VTS). This system has been operating since 2017 and has shown positive results in saving lives and property. LATRA will continue to use technology to solve transport challenges in the country.

 

(Source: Authority)
body.processed:
The Land Transport Regulatory Authority (LATRA) is a Government Authority established by Act of Parliament No. 3 of 2019. This Act repealed the former Land and Water Transport Regulatory Authority (SUMATRA) Act. LATRA is mandated to regulate the land transport sector, particularly freight and passenger transport (long-distance buses, urban buses, freight vehicles, taxis, two-wheelers and three-wheelers), rail transport and cable transport. LATRA’s headquarters are in Dodoma and the Authority has offices in all twenty-six (26) regions of Mainland Tanzania.

Transportation is a necessary service and an important indicator of development in any society. Developments in transportation services reflect changes in lifestyle, civilization, and economic development.

In this era, the use of modern technology is revolutionizing various sectors, including the land transport sector, LATRA facilitates the use of such technologies as a solution to challenges in the transport sector. This is done with the participation of stakeholders from the public and private sectors. One of the achievements recognized is the Vehicle Tracking System (VTS). This system has been operating since 2017 and has shown positive results in saving lives and property. LATRA will continue to use technology to solve transport challenges in the country.

 

(Source: Authority)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: SODIC is a customer-focused mixed-use developer. Twenty five years young and driven by a progressive vision, innovation is at the heart of everything we do, our purpose is to deliver dynamic communities to which our residents belong. SODIC has proven to be a permanent fixture in Egypt’s real estate industry, pioneering the development of high-end urban and suburban communities on the outskirts of Cairo.

body.value: SODIC is a customer-focused mixed-use developer. Twenty five years young and driven by a progressive vision, innovation is at the heart of everything we do, our purpose is to deliver dynamic communities to which our residents belong. SODIC has proven to be a permanent fixture in Egypt’s real estate industry, pioneering the development of high-end urban and suburban communities on the outskirts of Cairo. We leverage our strong culture and values, staying customer-centric and delivering trendsetting projects that we continue to reinvest in, enabling us to grow our sales while enhancing our brand equity. Subsequently, the strong demand for SODIC products allows us to price our developments at a premium to the market. It also provides SODIC with access to accretive land partnership deals and facilitates our ability to monetize land. We remain committed to maintaining our strong reputation for quality developments with timely deliveries while paying consistent attention to Egypt’s dynamic real estate industry and client needs.

body.value:
DAA Architects is the premier specialist architectural hotel design company in Nigeria. DAA offers Architecture, Interior Design, Project Management and Procurement Advice to the hospitality industry in West Africa.

DAA Architects has worked with the most important operators in the industry, including Marriott, Hilton, Accor, Radisson, Best Western, and Movenpick. Current projects include a 142 key Hyatt Regency hotel in LAGOS, and a mixed use tower development in Accra, Ghana, including a 184 key Radisson Hotel. Another 70 key mid-market Hotel is under construction in Gusau, capital of Zamfara State.

DAA has provided design services across most of Nigeria, and also in Cameroun Republic.

attributes.content: The Ghana Highway Authority was established as a body corporate under NRC Decree 298 in December 1974. The NRCD 298 was repealed by GHA Act 1997 (Act 540 ) which limited the Authority's responsibility to the administration, control, development and maintenance of the country's trunk road network totalling 15,000 km and related facilities in Ghana. Its mission is to provide Road Infrastructure Engineering and Management Services at best value – least cost to support the socio-economic development of Ghana and beyond.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Rolider Ghana Limited is a Ghanaian-registered civil engineering and infrastructure construction company, operating as a subsidiary of Rolider Ltd, an established Israeli construction firm. Since its establishment in 2006, Rolider Ghana has become a recognized player in Ghana’s infrastructure sector, delivering a wide range of public works and transportation projects.

body.value:
Rolider Ghana Limited is a Ghanaian-registered civil engineering and infrastructure construction company, operating as a subsidiary of Rolider Ltd, an established Israeli construction firm. Since its establishment in 2006, Rolider Ghana has become a recognized player in Ghana’s infrastructure sector, delivering a wide range of public works and transportation projects.

Specializing in the construction of roads, bridges, drainage systems, and other civil infrastructure, the company combines local knowledge with international expertise from its parent company. Rolider Ghana is equipped with a modern fleet of heavy-duty machinery and a team of highly trained engineers, allowing it to handle complex, large-scale construction assignments.

The company is notably involved in Ghana’s Eastern Corridor Road Development Programme, where it has completed key sections such as the Jasikan–Kadjebi stretch and is currently engaged in other strategic segments of the corridor.

The company operates across Africa and Saudi Arabia. In West Africa, CRSG has a notable presence in Guinea, Mali, Senegal, and Sierra Leone. Beyond West Africa, its activities extend to Tanzania, Mozambique, and Zambia. The CRSG has been prominently involved in bridge construction throughout these regions, including the Dinghiraye and Niger Bridges in Guinea, the Medinandiathbe River Bridge in Senegal, the Mpiji Bridge and Ruvu Bridge in Tanzania, and the Gao Bridge in Mali.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co., Ltd. (ZPMC) is a famous heavy-duty equipment manufacturer, and a state owned company listed on A and B shares on Shanghai Stock Exchange. The major shareholder is China Communications Construction Company Limited(CCCC) which is one of top 500 companies in the world. The former company was Gongmao Shipyard founded in 1885 and it was renamed Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co., Ltd. in 2009. ZPMC headquarters is located in Shanghai.

body.value:
Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co., Ltd. (ZPMC) is a famous heavy-duty equipment manufacturer, and a state owned company listed on A and B shares on Shanghai Stock Exchange. The major shareholder is China Communications Construction Company Limited(CCCC) which is one of top 500 companies in the world. The former company was Gongmao Shipyard founded in 1885 and it was renamed Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co., Ltd. in 2009. ZPMC headquarters is located in Shanghai. ZPMC also has 6 production bases located in Shanghai, Nantong with total area of 6,670,000 square meters and 10 kilometers coastline, especially the Changxing Base, which has a 5 kilometers deep water coastline, and includes a heavy-duty dock of 3.7 kilometers. ZPMC is one of the largest port machinery manufacturers in the world and owns a fleet of more than 20 transportation vessels which are from 60,000 DWT to 100,000 DWT can deliver large products in whole to all over the world.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value:
(Also known as La Congolaise d’Exploitation Minière)

Congolese Mining Company, abbreviated COMINIERE, is a limited company under OHADA business law. It is a young company created on April 12, 2010, following a decision by the General Meeting of Shareholders, namely the Ministry of Finance and the National Social Security Institute.

Shareholders
The share capital of COMINIERE SA is 90% owned by the Congolese state through the Ministry of Finance and 10% by the National Social Security Institute.

Corporate Purpose
The company's purpose, both for itself and on behalf of third parties, is to carry out all operations of study, prospecting, research and mining of tin, columbite-tantalite, and all concessible and recoverable mineral substances as well as all operations of concentration and metallurgical and chemical treatment, transformation, marketing and export of these substances and their derivatives, mining engineering and all operations likely to promote the achievement of the corporate purpose.
And generally, all financial, commercial, industrial, movable and real estate operations, all acquisitions of interest or participation, in any form whatsoever, in any existing or to be created company or business which may be directly or indirectly linked to the above object or to any similar or related object, of a nature to promote its realization, its extension or its development.

 

(Source: Organisation)
